SENT.plain: A 39 year old man with Marfan syndrome presented with multiple pulmonary emboli and renal, hepatic, and splenic infarcts of unknown aetiology
The combination of thromboemboli and physical features initially suggested homocystinuria; however, laboratory examination showed no evidence for this disorder
Laboratory evaluation identified no coagulation abnormalities
This patient represents the unusual occurrence of hypercoagulability in a patient with Marfan syndrome
